reviews.text: We stayed at the Oscar Hotel in Athens for 2 nights. It wasn't the greatest hotel, but it wasn't the worst. The showers were so small. The breakfast was pretty decent. It's right off the metro line which was very convient. But it was clean and the staff was nice.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel, Decent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Oscar hotel was one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. The area was dirty and the roof-top view was nothing worthwhile. The breakfast was horrible, and even though the breakfast hours run long, the food was usually gone after 2 hours because of the hungry mob. The staff was insulting, rude, and not helpful. I strongly advise to interact with the staff as little as possible. The rooms were very old, and need to be re-modeled. They were also noisy, our room was near the top and when they would have drinks at the bar it was so noisy we could not go to sleep. I would not recommend staying at this hotel. There are many other 3-star hotels that are worth the money.
reviews.title: Do Not Recommend!

likes.disliked: — The staff, the rooms, the pool, and most of all the breakfast.

reviews.text: Excellent location near metro and Larissa station; most horrible breakfast. Rooms are ok.
reviews.title: neither good nor (too) bad

reviews.text: The hotel is neither good nor too bad, but book without the breakfast. We (family with one 10-year old child) never ever had a breakfast so utterly untastefull. Happily, just 50 meters away is the Larissa-station, wich has a good coffee-corner with sandwiches etc.
reviews.title: It is a cats toilet, not a hotel

likes.disliked: — cats excrements everywhere and the rudness of the male receptionist

reviews.title: I've stayed here 3 times its so good!
reviews.text: The rooms and bathrooms are ok. A bit outdated but not too bad at all and big enough if you're not planning to stay inside too long. The lifts are very slow, but when at holiday...... Airco worked adequatly and the rooms have a big balcony overlooking nothing worthwhile. A small swimmingpool at the top floor with a view of the Acropolis gives a nice refreshment coming back after a sweaty day in Athens.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly staff, typical good Greek hospitality, excellent location next to metro, clean large rooms, piscine with fantastic view to Parthenon, good price, close to museums and other main attractions (Omonia, Sintagma, Plaka, Monastiraki, Akropolis), sufficient breakfast, beautiful paintings from famous painters in the basement.
reviews.title: MariaK

likes.liked: — good locations friendly staff, clean room, breakfast

reviews.text: Excellent hotel, with extremely friendly staff, good breakfast, logical price, very good location-METRO, close to museums and to down town area, exceptional expensive paintings on the walls from very famous European painters. We stay in the hotel for 4 nights with my wife.
reviews.title: Panos1

likes.liked: — with extremely friendly staff, good breakfast, logical price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was pretty good except for the unfriendly staff, we had questions regarding different things and they were unattentive and wanted to get rid of you fast, the only person that actually helped us was the guy at the front desk that was working in the morning..the mid-shift guy and the late-night one were terrible!
reviews.title: staff needs retraining

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this hotel to be absolutely brilliant!! We were slightly worried when we looked at other peoples' reviews about this hotel, but were in fact extremely impressed by what we found!
reviews.title: Top Hotel!!!!!

likes.disliked: — There were no sun loungers by the pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff of this hotel were very helpful and willing to go the extra mile for you. The maids cleaned the room everyday and gave fresh towels. There was shampoo, and other helpful toiletries in the room and a fridge which was great to keep drinks cool in hot Athens!
reviews.title: Not what the pictures show

likes.disliked: — The bed was hard and I could feel the springs all night long.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good price for a good hotel. The rooms were adequate, nothing fancy, and included a balcony. The downside to the view was that there was some major construction across the street, so if you are wanting to sleep in, you might not want a room facing that side. The TV channels didn't offer a very wide selection. Their breakfast buffet had a large variety and even had scambled eggs. There is a nice pool on top and the hotel is right next to public transport, so overall I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Good price

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at two hotels in Athens: the Stanley and the Oscar. It was a day & night experience. Where the Stanley had cramped quarters, impolite staff and a certain lack of charm, the Oscar was delightful.
reviews.title: Very good experience

reviews.text: - There are 6-8 computers in the lobby (tastefully separated from the lounge area) for internet use. While you do need to purchase a card to use the computers, access is easy, quick and available 24/7.
reviews.title: Mixed bag, good and bad

reviews.text: - The room was spacious and you easily could do a full turn in the bathroom with arms outstretched (unlike the Stanley, which had bathrooms smaller than a coat closet).
reviews.title: Awful hotel, Beware ! (AHTUNG !)

reviews.text: - The staff was helpful and polite. While we only stayed there for one night, we ended up approaching the lobby desk with questions on nearby attractions no less than 3 times, and they were always patient and willing to take the time to help.
reviews.title: Average but cheap, good location
Oscar Hotel Athens
reviews.text: Hotel was great location to train station, and metro. Hotel O.K. Rugs dirty, Baths clean.
Staff ? night desk girl not helpful at all, rude. Guys in day nice.
reviews.title: excellent position, good deal.

reviews.text: Internet poor. better around the corner. Breakfast fair. not big selection. Only recommend because of location.
reviews.title: Unless you are on a really tight budget...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only stayed at oscar for one night, but everything was ok. clean room and bathroom, good breakfest ( yet simple ). Frendly staff. The position of the hotel is very good - next to the metro station ( larissa station ), and also next to the train station. It is very noisy that particular area all the time ( cross the street is a big and noisy site ). Anyway it worth all our money. THE SINGLE PROBLEM IS IF U TRAVEL SOLO, OR ONLY WITH YOUR WIFE/HUSBAND - THAT AREA HAS A BIG RISC OF CRIMINALITY!!!
reviews.title: Caveat Emptor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was at the last leg of our trip and was definintely the worst of the three. The staff were unfriendly and not really willing to help foreigners. I heard more "No's" then actual answers to questions I asked the front desk. There's a big selection for breakfast and the bathrooms were really nice...though it doesn't match the rest of the room as the beds, floor, and bedding look and feel like it's seen better days. Another plus would probably be that it's just a few short steps from the Metro and the bus stop is right across the street. Like I said, unless you are on a pretty tight budget, there seems to be better hotels in the area.
reviews.title: OK Hotel but Bad Area
